page.title: 20Esholt Nunnery
page.content: {The Naughty Nuns and their Scandalous {Habits:-}In 1305 the prioress of Esholt Nunnery offered her resignation {One of her nuns was pregnant!!} What had been going on? It seems that visitors had been invited to spend the night in the nuns' cells.Whenever the nuns felt the need to escape their cloistered lives they broke down the boundary wall and went off down the back lane and across the bridge.The archbishop ordered that the lane was out of bounds,that a high wall be built,that the doors were to be locked and not reopened until 7am,and that the nuns were forbidden to leave with- out a chaperone.The nunnery was finally closed during the Dissolution of the Monasteries by Henry VIII.By then there were only 10 nuns left.The site of the Nunnery was redeveloped in 1703 by Walter Calverley.
